resources.string: Welcome to FreeNozzle, a little tool to help you design or study any rocket nozzle you can imagine.
To start, choose what you want to do!
To start with, set the conditions in the combustion chamber (starting pressure and temperature):
You need to set the gas properties, too. You can choose between its molecular mass or its specific constant. Don\'t forget to enter its adiabatic constant too!
When everything has been filled, press next!

We\'re looking at supersonic nozzles, so there needs to be a throat with M=1. In order to do the remaining calculus you need to enter either the mass flux or the throat\'s diameter, along with the pressure in the exit and in the ambient.
Cases when M=1 is not reached in the nozzle throat will be done in the future, so please enter a value of Pe that is smaller than
In the design problem, you only to specify a force and the exit amb ambient pressure.

Keep in mind that if the ratio Pe/Pa violates any of the Summerfield conditions, like Pe/Pa >= 0.4 or Pe/Pa >= (1.88*Me - 1)^-0.64, the flow inside the nozzle will experiment separation, making any calculus made here invalid.
